question:
Consider the following defence equipments / capabilities in news in recent times:
  1. National Advanced Surface to Air Missile System-II
  2. Terminal High Altitude Area Defence system
  3. Patriot Advance Capability
Which of the above are India's indigenous developments?
explanation:
The United States Department of State has given approval for the potential sale of the NASAMS-II to New Delhi via the FMS route.
  • It is an integrated air defence weapons system.
The NASAM-II or National Advanced Surface to Air Missile System-II is an integrated air defence weapons system (IADWS). It is a missile shield (missile defence system). It includes launchers, radars, targeting systems and also guidance systems along with related equipment for support.
  • It is to be sold by the US to India.
The NASAMS-II is to be sold by USA to India for approximately 1.8 billion USD. The system is currently used by Washington D C. The potential sale was recently approved by the US Department of State and is to be through the FMS or Foreign Military Sale route.
  • The THAAD is not a part of the sale.
The THAAD is not a part of this sale. USA has been pressuring India to buy the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense system and the PAC-3 (Patriot Advance Capability) system. However, India has instead gone for Russiaâ€™s S-400 Triumf system.
